oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hamilton Tabernacle United Primitive Baptist Church, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Hamilton Tabernacle United Primitive Baptist Church located at 2407 Booker Street in Nashville, Tennessee. Originally called Hamilton Tabernacle Baptist Church, this structure was built in 1942. The foundation is made of concrete blocks that have been painted white. The exterior walls are stone. The roof is gabled and made of tar shingles. The windows are red frosted glass. The doors are made of wood with glass windows. Special additions to the original structure include a front entrance of red brick with a concrete block foundation and a gabled, tar shingle roof. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hamilton Tabernacle United Primitive Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Hamilton Tabernacle Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
